reasoning: Premature aging syndromes are extremely rare genetic disorders. Hutchinson-Gilford Progeria Syndrome (HGPS, the most common form) affects approximately 1 in 4-8 million births. Total global cases estimated at <1,000 individuals alive, with <50 new diagnoses per year worldwide, translating to <0.01 per 100k person-years.
source: Gordon LB et al. (2014). Progeria: A paradigm for translational medicine. Cell. 156(3):400-407
